text.section: Records involving medical laboratory services and copies of reports of laboratory tests shall be kept for the period of time and in a manner prescribed by regulation of the secretary. They shall be made available to representatives of the cabinet for inspection during regular office hours.

Each medical laboratory shall establish its own quality control program acceptable to the cabinet including use of, where applicable, reference or control sera and other biological samples, concurrent calibration standards, and control chart recordings.

law.history: Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. VI, sec. 107(22). -- Created 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 180, sec. 21.
